name: WebQuestions
summary: An open-domain QA set of questions from Google Suggest queries, curated to be answerable using the Freebase knowledge graph. It has about 5.8K questions with crowdsourced answers (entities in Freebase)​:contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}. Often used to evaluate KB-QA or open QA.
size: 5,810 question-answer pairs (original)​:contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}; processed version WebQuestionsSP has 6,642 QA pairs​:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12} with annotated SPARQL queries.
download: Original data from the authors’ site (Berant et al. 2013) or via HuggingFace `web_questions` (which has 6,642 examples version).
notes: Answers are Freebase entries (or lists of entities). The dataset is commonly used for semantic parsing to knowledge base (with the WebQuestionsSP variant augmenting questions with SPARQL). Domain is broad open trivia.
